meanings.definition: The act of kissing and caressing amorously.
meanings.sent1: During the movie, I saw the couple in the park engaging in necking.
meanings.sent2: Teenagers often engage in necking as a way to show affection.
meanings.sent3: The romantic comedy had a scene where the characters were necking in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: Their necking was like a dance, each movement perfectly in sync.
meanings.sent5: The image of their necking under the stars stayed with me for days.

meanings.definition: The part of a garment that encircles the neck.
meanings.sent1: She adjusted the necking of her scarf to keep warm in the cold.
meanings.sent2: The necking of the sweater was soft and comfortable.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer added a unique twist to the necking of the dress.
meanings.sent4: The delicate lace necking of the blouse added an elegant touch.
meanings.sent5: The necking on the jacket kept the wind out on the windy day.

meanings.definition: The part of an object near the top that resembles a neck in shape or position.
meanings.sent1: The necking of the bottle made it easy to pour the liquid.
meanings.sent2: The necking of the vase was slender and graceful.
meanings.sent3: The toy robot had a necking that made it look like a friendly alien.
meanings.sent4: The necking of the lamp gave it a modern and sleek appearance.
meanings.sent5: The necking of the guitar allowed for easy tuning and adjustments.
